page.title: 18RAILWAYMAN
page.content: They had one weeks holiday per year rising to 2 weeks as the years went by.They also had Christmas Day and Good Friday as holidays. When he was transferred to Long Sutton station he had to cycle there and back every day which is about 12 miles. The quickest he ever cycled it was half an hour with back wind. He was made redundant in 1953 when the station closed at night. He then became a gardener and chauffeur. The railway at Wisbech St.Mary closed altogether in the 1960's. Mr Wright despite being 76 years of age still leads a very active life,spending many hours each day gardening and weaving baskets.The significant point to note however is that Mr Wright is blind.
